newsitem.title: FINLAND: Finland ready to buy currency from mkt - Niinisto.
newsitem.headline: Finland ready to buy currency from mkt - Niinisto.

text.p: Finnish Finance Minister Sauli Niinisto said in a statement on Tuesday that the government's economic policy committee had decided that the state could buy foreign currencies for debt servicing directly from the market.
He put the state's 1997 foregin currency debt servicing expenditure at 42 billion markka.

"If the economic policy situation so requires, the Ministry of Finance stands ready to make spot or forward purchases directly from the currency markets to obtain foreign exchange needed for the government's foreign debt service, instead of buying these currencies from the central bank," Niinisto said.
The formal decision by the economic policy committee, which is chaired by the prime minister, is in line with an agreement last week between the finance ministry and the Bank of Finland.
"The committee emphasises the importance of maintaining a stable currency situation," Niinisto said in the statement, but did not elaborate.
"The government's total debt service costs (repayments and interest payments) on its foreign debt during 1997 amount to 42 billion markka (equivalent to about $8.5 billion)," Niinisto said.
At end-1996, the state's foreign currency denominated debt was 175.0 billion markka, according to state treasury figures.
